questions.question: 1. Nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) uses which electromagnetic wave to analyze material?

explanations.a: Radio waves are used to flip the spin of protons in NMR.
explanations.b: Ultraviolet waves are used in UV-Visible spectroscopy
explanations.c: X-ray are used in X-ray diffraction spectroscopy.
explanations.d: Microwaves are used in rotational spectroscopy.

questions.question: 2. Mass spectrometry differs from spectroscopy because:

answers.b: it involves the absorption of radio waves.
answers.c: it involves the absorption of infrared waves.
answers.d: it involves the absorption of ultraviolet waves

explanations.a: it is a destructive technique as it destroys the sample and breaks it into smaller fragments.
explanations.b: it does not absorb radio waves.
explanations.c: it does not absorb infrared waves.
explanations.d: it does not absorb UV rays too.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following wavelength ranges is associated with UV spectroscopy?

explanations.b: this is the near IR region and not used in UV spectroscopy
explanations.c: This is the UV-Visible range. UV Spectroscopy uses this range of radiations.
explanations.d: this is the X-ray range of radiation

questions.question: 4. In infrared spectroscopy which frequency range is known as the fingerprint region?

explanations.a: this is the fingerprint region of IR spectroscopy where a large number of peaks are obtained and it is difficult to identify them
explanations.b: this is the IR range for C=C, C=O and C=N.
explanations.c: this is the IR range for C triple bonded to C and N.
explanations.d: this is the IR range for single bonds involving H.
